YOU!

Elevator Pitch

We believe...

Getting started sucks.
Integration is hard.
We make mistakes.
Life is too short.

We address this by...

  • Making getting started easy
  • Simplifing otherwise complex choices
  • Ensuring predictably successful results
  • Saving time instead of wasting time

  • Extendable framework

  • → Rapid application development
  • → Drop-in extensions that bring Java together
  • → Command-oriented interactions for humans
  • → Real, achievable results
  • → True enjoyment

Brings our communities together

  • Teaching
  • Promoting
  • Automating
  • Enjoying

Unique Selling Points

5. Streamlined tutorials and demos.
4. The most productive and familiar way to get our tech into the hands of developers.
3. The easiest way to get started with new Java libraries and frameworks.
2. Write once use everywhere.
1. The fastest way to get started with Java EE.

The last 18 months

  • * Provide Vanilla Java EE Scaffolding
  • * Provide Database Reverse Engineering
  • * Deliver with JBoss Developer Studio
  • * Generate REST service endpoints
  • * Get hosted (http://forge.jboss.org)
  • * Integrate with JDF Stacks and BOMs
  • * Rapid, monthly release cycle
  • * Stabilize the Runtime
  • * Integrate with AS7
  • * Integrate with OpenShift
  • * Configuration and hints

Over 275 pull requests from NON-employees

The next 18 months

  • * Start up faster than AS7
  • * More general purpose commands
  • * Enable truly reusable addon development
  • * Redesign the website and documentation
  • * Come up with a cool name for addons
  • * To be decided this week...
  • * AND!

2

Truly re-usable addons

Write once, run everywhere.

Bring JBoss to more communities

This week

  • * What does your team need from Forge? (All)
  • * Documentation strategy (All)
  • * Addon version strategy (Forge Team)
  • * Pretend mode "Accept these changes?" (Forge & JBDS)
  • * Project manipulation API (Forge Team)
  • * Legacy support (Forge Team)
  • * Scaffolding (HTML5, Errai, RichFaces, AeroGear, Forge)

They'll work together!

And then we'll eat them...
